resources:
javaQuiz This set of Java Multiple Choice Questions and Answers (MCQs) focuses on basic of java. There is only one correct option for each question. Which is a reserved word in the Java programming language? Which one of the following will declare an array and initialize it with five numbers? Which is the valid declarations within an interface definition? Which one is a valid declaration of a boolean? What is the numerical range of a char? Which of these is long data type literal? Which of these can be returned by the operator | ? Literals in java must be appended by which of these? Literal can be of which of these data types? Which of these is necessary condition for automatic type conversion in Java?
method native reference array /
Array a = new Array(5); int [] a = {23,22,21,20,19}; / int a [] = new int[5]; int [5] array;
public double methoda(); / public final double methoda(); static void methoda(double d1); protected void methoda(double d1);
boolean b1 = 0; boolean b2 = \'false\'; boolean b3 = false; / boolean b4 = Boolean.false();
-128 to 127 -(2^15) to (2^15)-1 0 to 32767 0 to 65535 /
0x99fffL / ABCDEFG 0x99fffa 99671246
Integer Boolean Character Integer or Boolean
L I D L and I
integer float boolean Class Object
The destination type is smaller than source type The destination type is larger than source type The destination type can be larger or smaller than source type None of the mentioned
